body.text:
Isabella‚Äôs gaze met Grayson; the tension was palpable as her audacious proposal hung between them.

‚ÄúYou heard me right, Mr. Grayson Blake. I‚Äôm offering to be your wife,‚Äù she reiterated.

‚ÄúAnd what do you get in return?‚Äù he asked, his voice edged with curiosity after a brief pause.

‚ÄúI-I want out of the entertainment industry that‚Äôs been holding me captive; I need two hundred million.‚Äù

In two swift strides, Grayson closed the gap between them. Isabella found herself backing up until cool plaster met her shoulder blades. His proximity was overwhelming, his scent intoxicating. She swallowed hard, feeling herself melt under the intensity of his gaze.

‚ÄúBut a wife is expected to fulfill all her duties,‚Äù he murmured, his lips curving into a wolfish grin, ‚ÄúIncluding intimacy.‚Äù A cold shiver ran down Isabella‚Äôs spine as the words sank in.

***

Isabella

I just finished my scene for ‚ÄúWhispers of the Heart,‚Äù a romance drama series where I have a small but important role. The show will premiere on major streaming platforms next season and is getting much attention.

Not far from where I‚Äôm standing, I spot Gabriel Sterling, the lead actor, sharing a hearty laugh with Sabrina Morrison. People have been discussing a possible real-life romance between them for the past two years because of their on-screen chemistry.

The public has adored them since a live interview two years ago when Sabrina blushed the moment she first saw Gabriel. And, humbly, my boyfriend didn‚Äôt embarrass her.

That‚Äôs right! Gabriel became my fianc√© two years ago when he proposed to me‚Äîright around the time he signed a contract to show affection with Sabrina publicly.

I should be used to seeing their on-screen sweetness by now‚Äîthe stolen glances and tender touches‚Äîbut every scene still stings, a sharp reminder of the cost of fame and the secrets we carry.

My talent manager, Sophia, a petite woman, approached me. ‚ÄúYour scenes are wrapped for today. The crew also mentioned you‚Äôre free to head home now.‚Äù

Sophia escorted me to my vehicle. She efficiently arranged my belongings in the back, ensuring everything was in order.

As I settled into the plush leather of the front passenger seat, Sophia hesitated.

‚ÄúAnyway‚Ä¶‚Äù she began, taking a deep breath before continuing, ‚ÄúUh, I heard there will be multiple bed scenes for the main cast in this series. They‚Äôre scheduled to start filming next week.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù I exclaimed, raising my voice in disbelief. ‚ÄúWhy wasn‚Äôt I informed about this?‚Äù

‚ÄúIsa, this series is a mature romance, not meant for young audiences,‚Äù Sophia says gently but firmly. ‚ÄúThere will be intimate scenes in some episodes.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut Gabriel didn‚Äôt mention any of this to me,‚Äù I replied.

Sophia‚Äôs eyes softened with understanding. ‚ÄúMaybe he didn‚Äôt want you to think poorly of him or worry unnecessarily.‚Äù

That is the case as always‚ÄîI‚Äôm the one who constantly worries.

‚ÄúGabriel has never accepted bed scenes in the past,‚Äù I muse, almost to myself. ‚ÄúWhy would he agree to them now?‚Äù

Sophia stayed quiet, knowing when to give me space. She started the engine, and the car filled with a low hum. She could tell I was exhausted from being on set for 48 grueling hours, waiting for my scenes to wrap up. The long days and nights had turned into a blur of bright lights and repeated takes.

I closed my eyes, trying to find a moment of peace. But even in the darkness behind my eyelids, I can‚Äôt escape the dull ache in my chest.

Sophia said goodbye after dropping me off at the fancy skyscraper building where Gabriel and I lived. He proposed to me two years ago, and I agreed to move in with him instead of renting a separate place.

Falling asleep, I only woke up when darkness had settled in, startled by rustling sounds in the room. Gabriel‚Äôs green eyes greeted me. He was standing at the door, looking bothered.

His usual sweetness was long gone. ‚ÄúUh‚Ä¶‚Äù he cleared his throat.

‚ÄúGabriel, I heard you‚Äôll be having bed scenes with Sabrina,‚Äù I said, trying to keep my voice steady. Not wanting to sound like I was interrogating him, my voice shook a bit, especially since this was something he should have told me himself.

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù He approached me and acted like everything was normal, and that I had nothing to worry about. I instinctively pulled away when he tried to kiss me on the cheek. Gabriel frowned, his brow furrowing deeply.

‚ÄúIsa, this is a romance series! Besides, didn‚Äôt you already know about this since you also signed the contract as part of the cast?‚Äù

The heat rose to my temples. ‚ÄúGabriel, I have a small role! I was there when the director and writer explained the overall plot of this series, but not the specific scenes, especially since I‚Äôm not one of the main actors! You should have told me about it before accepting this role!‚Äù

‚ÄúIsa, I‚Äôm tired!‚Äù he murmured, exhaustion clear on his face. ‚ÄúCome on, I don‚Äôt want to argue. The intimate scenes are part of the role. I‚Äôm the lead and must accept whatever scenes they give me.‚Äù

Looking at him, I felt a wave of exhaustion wash over me. It wasn‚Äôt just physical tiredness but an emotional weariness that seemed to seep into my bones. I never felt that he truly valued my feelings or considered how his actions affected me.

‚ÄúGabriel, let‚Äôs break up.‚Äù

Gabriel‚Äôs frown deepened.

‚ÄúStop being ridiculous. Are you breaking up with me just because I agreed to the intimate scenes with Sabrina?‚Äù he asked, his voice tinged with exasperation.

I haven‚Äôt been comfortable with his relationship with Sabrina for a long time, and to be honest, she constantly nitpicks me when Gabriel isn‚Äôt around, her snide comments barely disguised as friendly banter. Since Sabrina is the main cast of this series, the crew is always on her side.

‚ÄúBaby, come on. Don‚Äôt be too petty,‚Äù Gabriel pleaded, running a hand through his tousled dark hair. ‚ÄúYou know I‚Äôm doing this for the fans. They‚Äôve been supporting me for years, and they wanted to see me step out of my usual conservative roles. Besides, Leo told me that this project could help me get internationally recognized. This is just a scene. I won‚Äôt do anything that will harm our relationship.‚Äù

The thing is, his actions have already damaged our relationship beyond repair.

Gabriel reached out, his warm fingers intertwining with mine as he lifted my hand to his lips. I searched my feelings, and honestly, I couldn‚Äôt feel anything anymore.

I often gave in during situations like this, plastering on a smile and forcing myself to understand his perspective. But now, I feel like I‚Äôm tired, the weight of constant compromise bearing down on me.

Looking into his stormy green eyes, I insisted, ‚ÄúGabriel, I‚Äôm serious. I want to break up.‚Äù

‚ÄúIsa, don‚Äôt be unreasonable. I know you‚Äôre still angry...‚Äù he tried to console me. ‚ÄúWe have a planned trip to Aspen, Colorado next weekend, right? The crisp mountain air, just the two of us...‚Äù

‚ÄúGabriel, next weekend is our supposed wedding,‚Äù I reminded him, my tone flat. His face remained calm, not a flicker of recognition passing across his features.

Sophia told me that Gabriel‚Äôs intimate scenes with Sabrina are scheduled for next week.

He paused for a moment but then smiled. ‚ÄúI know, baby. Leo has already booked the officiant for the wedding at the resort. It‚Äôll just be the two of us for our ceremony. I‚Äôm excited to marry you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve postponed the wedding twice already. I hope it finally happens this time,‚Äù I said bitterly.

I could see the guilt flash across his face.

He was often called by the management of Golden Stage Entertainment‚Äîthe agency that handles both of us. The first time Gabriel canceled the wedding, Leo, his talent manager, informed him that the management suddenly called him to explain the new project. The second time, Sabrina had a scandal, and the management wanted Gabriel to speak on her behalf, using his reputation to calm the media frenzy.

I wonder now what excuse he might have this time. It‚Äôs as if I‚Äôm already anticipating our trip to the secluded resort won‚Äôt push through again, the disappointment, a familiar ache in my chest.

I‚Äôm tired of waiting, loving him, and being second best in his career.

Gabriel forced a smile and kissed my hand again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll finally get married this time, babe. I promise.‚Äù

No longer wanting to argue with Gabriel, all that‚Äôs left is to wait for the day, preparing my heart for the inevitable disappointment.

***

Sophia and I met for a photo shoot because I had taken on a small brand to promote their skincare products. This was also the day to capture some intimate scenes between Gabriel and Sabrina for the romance series, a fact that felt heavy in my stomach.

Sophia approached me after the photoshoot. She handed me a chilled bottle of water and wrapped me in a plush white robe because I was only wearing a thin tube top to showcase the smoothness of my skin in the photos.

‚ÄúYou know, I‚Äôm more scared of what you‚Äôre doing right now than any of these promo shots,‚Äù Sophia said, her brow furrowed with concern as we headed to the dressing room to change. ‚ÄúAre you sure you‚Äôre okay with Gabriel and Sabrina‚Äôs setup on set?‚Äù

I took a sip of water, savoring the cool liquid.

‚ÄúI tried to break up with Gabriel last week when I found out about the scenes,‚Äù I said casually as if discussing the weather.

Her eyes widened. ‚ÄúYou did? And he agreed?‚Äù

‚ÄúSophia, do I look stupid?‚Äù I asked instead. There was a hint of sadness in my voice. ‚ÄúGabriel seemed to see a pattern with me. He‚Äôd make a mistake in our relationship. He‚Äôd coax me, and I would eventually forgive whatever we argued about because I couldn‚Äôt stand not giving in to him. But I feel like it‚Äôs becoming a routine, a dance I‚Äôm tired of performing.‚Äù

Sophia scratched the side of her head. She doesn‚Äôt like Gabriel for me because I can‚Äôt stand up for myself with my boyfriend. In truth, she was shocked when she found out that I was in a relationship with a famous actor.

‚ÄúDoes this mean you two reconciled, and he persuaded you to do his intimate scenes with Sabrina?‚Äù

We entered the dressing room, the door clicking shut behind us and giving us a private space where no one could hear us.

‚ÄúHe already decided and signed a contract. There‚Äôs nothing more I can do about it,‚Äù I replied.

After changing into my casual clothes, Sophia informed me while reading a message on her phone.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs just one scene set to be filmed today,‚Äù she informed me.

I checked my watch. Gabriel needed to finish his scene because we had a flight to Colorado tomorrow. Our long-awaited wedding weekend was just around the corner, a bittersweet promise.

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs go to the film set,‚Äù I suggested to Sophia.

Even though Sophia was hesitant to take me to the scene because of her concerns, her eyes clouded with worry, she still accompanied me to a luxurious hotel.

Of course, my father felt better about her. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt speak like that, Charlotte. You did better than this wench!‚Äù

Mom reached out to hold my hand. ‚ÄúIsabella,‚Äù she pleaded, ‚Äúyour dad needs this project to support the company. It‚Äôs worth millions. Mr. Shaw has one request to continue this crucial contract: they want you to marry their son.‚Äù

‚ÄúI already met that jerk, Mom!‚Äù I spat, unable to hide my disgust. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a substance misuser and treats women horribly! You want me to marry someone you know won‚Äôt respect me?‚Äù The resentment in my voice was apparent, years of frustration boiling over.

My mother couldn‚Äôt meet my gaze, guilt etching deep lines on her face.

‚ÄúWhat are you so proud of?‚Äù Dad sneered, ‚ÄúThat boyfriend you‚Äôre clinging to doesn‚Äôt respect you either! He‚Äôs involved with someone else! Break up with Gabriel Sterling and do as we say if you want a place in this family!‚Äù

My father‚Äôs anger lashed out like a whip.

Charlotte‚Äôs lips curled into a smirk, her eyes glittering with malice. ‚ÄúOh, Uncle, don‚Äôt you know?‚Äù she chimed in, her voice sickeningly sweet. ‚ÄúI heard from Gabriel‚Äôs assistant that they already broke up!‚Äù

I burned with rage, wanting nothing more than to lash out at the witch who had poisoned my relationship with my parents. But holding back was necessary, knowing it would only give them more reason to criticize me.

‚ÄúGood! If you don‚Äôt marry the Shaws, we‚Äôll forget you‚Äôre our daughter!‚Äù my father threatened. My mother‚Äôs eyes widened in shock, but all I felt was a tightening knot of disappointment in my chest, a familiar ache growing for years.

Filled with determination and heartbreak, I declared, ‚ÄúThen go ahead, sever your ties with me!

The silence followed was overwhelming, shattered only by the sharp sound of a slap. A heavy hand struck my cheek.
